Package ohos.global.resource

Class Resource

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • ohos.global.resource.Resource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public abstract class Resource
extends InputStream
    Describes an input stream from which resource data can be read.

    Resource instances can be obtained only using the ResourceManager.getResource(int) method.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    ResourceManager, ResourceType

      • available

        public abstract int available​()
                       throws IOException
        Obtains the total number of bytes that can be read from the resource.
        Overrides:
        available in class InputStream
        Returns:
        Returns the total number of bytes that can be read from the resource.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an I/O error occurs.

      • read

        public abstract int read​(byte[] bytes,
                         int off,
                         int len)
                  throws IOException,
                         IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                         NullPointerException
        Reads up to len bytes from the resource.
        Overrides:
        read in class InputStream
        Parameters:
        bytes - Indicates the buffer into which the data is read.
        off - Indicates the start offset in array bytes at which the data is written.
        len - Indicates the maximum number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        Returns the total number of bytes read into the buffer; returns -1 if there is no more data because the end of the stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an I/O error occurs.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if array bytes is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Throws this exception if off is negative, len is negative, or len is greater than bytes.length - off.
        See Also:
        InputStream.read(byte[], int, int)

      • read

        public int read​()
         throws IOException
        Reads the next byte from the resource.
        Specified by:
        read in class InputStream
        Returns:
        Returns the data of the next byte; returns -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an I/O error occurs.

                    throws IOException
        Closes this resource and releases any system resources associated with the stream.

        Specified by:

        Throws:
